data.author: Morris

changelog.release_notes:
Added config option to show heart rate for watches with HRM
Row option: Active time | Heart rate

- added support for Timeline Quick View
- added support for Pebble 2

new features:
* show Pebble Health data on PT,PTS,PTR (steps, distance, activity)
* show temperature | seconds
* new "heart" character
* new highlight options two/three columns (color Pebbles only)
* improved battery life by limiting accesses to the permanent storage

bugfixes:
* improved memory usage on Aplite to prevent a possible crash
Fixed some bugs with "Skip splash screen" and "No animation" options (thanks to Joseph for reporting this!)

* added option to display "Calendar week | seconds" row (second ticks are not animated but will drain your battery faster)
* prevent screen updates if the Watchface is not in focus

* Added Pebble Time Round support
* Fixed battery level percent display on rows showing Battery level | Calender week

new options:
* show battery level in percent
* hide the serif of the 5 to increase readability
* new row option: Calendar week | weekday number
* new row option: Empty row
* adjust the custom time zones to daylight saving time automatically

improvements:
* better temperature conversion to improve accuracy of Fahrenheit
* single color black/white highlight automatically invert the text as needed
* temperature is displayed in 3 digits if necessary and if there is enough room
* if the third temperature digit is truncated this is indicated in the hints display

bug fixes:
* a smooth gradient from and to the same color now works
* fixed boxed highlight inversion
Added option to show "Month | Short year" to complement "Weekday name | day" date format.

new options:
* use a larger font
* display time in two additional custom time zones
* override the time format set in the watch settings
* display date with weekday name or number
* display hints permanently
* new highlight options for Pebble Time (gradients and stripes using 3 colors)

improvements:
* more character options for the splash screen
* hide hints during animations
* don't invert black and white highlight colors

bugfixes:
* fixed crash occurring on original Pebbles during "Long animation" tapping effect
Added Rainbow highlight option.

* Added more color highlight options (Pebble Time only)
* Added option to disable animations during a custom time period

* Added option to display Zulu time (UTC always in 24h format)
* Added option to display time in GMT (UTC in 12h/24h setting)
* Added longer double vibration option (Halfbeat)
* Added different invert option (everything, without highlight row, highlight row only)
* Added option to skip the splash screen at startup
* Added option to show the splash screen when tapping the watch
* Added SPACE as a valid character to display on the splash screen
* Added option to disable animation when BT is disconnected

* Only vibrate once to indicate BT disconnect instead of on every start.
* Vibrate for reconnection even if the Watchface was not active when the reconnect occurred
* Added option to show temperature in Celsius and Fahrenheit next to each other in one line

* Added options:
  - Vibrate on BT re-connect
  - Configure every vibration type (short, long, double, heartbeat)
  - Longer animation on tapping the watch
  - Invert the screen (permanently or on BT connection loss)
  - Track the Pebble Appstore Hearts of a Pebble App or Watchface
  - Configure the animation style (ease in, ease out, ease in and out, linear)
  - Enable a "No vibration" schedule
  - Disable all vibrations while charging
* Some extended options are only shown on request on the configuration page
* Performance and memory usage improvements on monochrome Pebbles
* Some minor bug fixes
Added workaround for JavaScript exception in 3.0 firmware.

* Made temperature update and caching intervals configurable
* Improvements on temperature update mechanism
Added more options to limit animations (disabled except for startup and/or tapping animation)

* Fixed Watchface running amok and crashing when all rows are set to random [who does that anyway? ;)]
* Fixed screen not returning to normal after scrambling when animations are disabled
* Added tapping effect: Animation
* Added monochrome highlight option: Dark Gray

* Improved performance on monochrome Pebbles
* Changed display of temperatures in Fahrenheit (it's now the same as for Celsius, always 2 digits except for temps < -9)
Fixed issue with settings page not opening on iPhones.

data.description:
Inspired by the Enigma Watchface shown during the Pebble Time Kickstarter campaign, I created my own version and added some twists of my own and lots of customization options. Works on Pebbles with color and monochrome displays.

All credit for the original design to the designer and the developer of the Enigma Watchface, Alex Kirov and Neal Patel.

Configurable options:
* Font size
* Highlight colors and style
* Invert the screen
* Five lines of data
* Splash screen
* Choose from:
  - Time (local and custom time zones)
  - Date
  - Random digits
  - Temperature (provided by OpenWeatherMap.org)
  - Watch battery level
  - Calendar week
  - Splash screen string
  - Pebble Appstore Hearts (provided by PblWeb.com)
  - Seconds
  - Pebble Health data
* Limit animations to conserve battery life
* Animation speed and style
* Tapping effects: Scramble, Display help, Animations, Show splash screen
* Display help permanently
* Time and Date format
* Temperature unit
* Fixed weather location or GPS
* Temperature update intervals
* Bluetooth connection loss and reconnection alert
* Low battery level alert
* Hourly vibration
* No vibration while charging
* No vibration/animation schedule
* Different vibration patterns

Please contact me for bug reports, questions or feature requests.

Please remember to "heart" the Watchface if you like it. Thanks!

latest_release.release_notes:
Added config option to show heart rate for watches with HRM
Row option: Active time | Heart rate

data.title: Slides of Time
